qas.question: What part of the US military developed an electromechanical analog computer to use on a submarine?
When did the US Navy invent an electromechanical computer to use on a submarine?
What type of math did the Torpedo Data computer use to fire a torpedo at a moving target?

context: By <a1_0>1938<a1_0/> <a0_0>the United States Navy<a0_0/> had developed an electromechanical analog computer small enough to use aboard a submarine. This was the Torpedo Data Computer, which used <a2_0>trigonometry<a2_0/> to solve the problem of firing a torpedo at a moving target. During World War II similar devices were developed in other countries as well.
